revealed_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
revealed_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
revealed_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.induration: It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there.
hidden_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I've noticed this mole or bump that seems to have gotten bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. It’s also kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. And it’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back. This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

Thank you for providing such a detailed description. Based on what you've told me, I'm concerned about the possibility of melanoma, a type of skin cancer. To help me better understand what's going on, have you noticed any swelling or tenderness in the lymph nodes near the concerning spot? Also, do you have a family history of skin cancer?
No, I haven’t noticed any swelling or tenderness in the lymph nodes. And no, as far as I know, there isn't a family history of skin cancer.

Thank you for clarifying. Since there's no lymph node involvement or family history, that's good to know. Could you describe the border of the mole or lesion for me? Is it well-defined and smooth, or is it irregular or jagged? Also, has there been any ulceration, or has the lesion broken open and formed an open sore? Finally, can you estimate the diameter of the lesion - is it less than 6mm, or greater than 6mm?

The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles. Yes, it’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back. And this thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.

Thank you for the additional information. The irregular borders and ulceration are concerning. Can you give me a rough estimate of the diameter of the lesion, in millimeters? Also, has the color changed, or is it multi-colored? Has the lesion been symmetrical, or has it been asymmetrical?
It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
Thank you for the additional information. The multi-colored appearance and asymmetry are also very concerning. Can you estimate the diameter of the lesion, in millimeters?
I’m not sure exactly, but it’s definitely bigger than the eraser on a pencil, so probably more than 6mm.

This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
